title: Cities with the most parkland per 1,000 residents in the U.S. 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents for 15 number of Citys.
City Anchorage has the highest Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents and Phoenix has the lowest Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents.
The Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents of City Anchorage is 98.14% larger than the minimum value at Phoenix.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing City in the x axis and Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents in the y axis.
The Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents is highest at City Anchorage and lowest at City Phoenix.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents for 15 number of Citys.
City Anchorage has the highest Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents and Phoenix has the lowest Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents.
The Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents of City Anchorage is 98.14% larger than the minimum value at Phoenix.
max_summary: This bar chart has 15 columns on the x axis representing City, and Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents in each City on the y axis.
The Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents is appeared to be the highest at City Anchorage and lowest at City Phoenix.
The second highest Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents is appeared to be the City Chesapeake.
City Anchorage has 98.14 times more Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents than City Phoenix which is has the lowest.
Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents at City Anchorage is 3012.8 , second place is Chesapeake at 228.1, and thirdly is Scottsdale at 126.4.
The City Anchorage has 11.14 times more Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents than average.
The Acres of parkland per 1,000 residents is 4057.5 if we add up values of all Citys.
